title: (x) Rounded geometric sans - VAG Rounded/Rundschrift {Conor}
content:
I feel a little embarrassed cause the name is on the tip of My brain.  
(The White title & grey body text)  
Also - any suggestions of other recommended rounded fonts would be appreciated - thanks it advance all!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/files/intro_6636.gif)
author: robertcooper

comments.content:
Other rounded fonts include:

[Gotham Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.typography.com/catalog/gothamrounded/) from [Hoefler & Frere-Jones](http://web.archive.org/wiki/hoefler_and_frere_jones)  
 [AG Book Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/ag-book-bq-rounded/) by [Günther Gerhard Lange](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Gunther%20Gerhard%20Lange)  
Helvetica Rounded  
 [Bryant](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/bryant2/index.html) by [Eric Olson](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Eric%20Olson) at [Process Type Foundry](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Process%20Type%20Foundry)  
 [Chevin](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000003) by [Nick Cooke](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Nick%20Cooke) aka [G-Type](http://web.archive.org/wiki/G-Type)
He’s brill, innit? :^) Nice cross-referencing, Conor.

Just adding the [Helvetica Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica/)-link. And of course there is [Arial Rounded](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/arial/), too. And a classic is also [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20070402195010/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/frankfurter/familytree.html).
